intro: Matelea belizensis, commonly known as the Belize matelea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America, particularly Belize. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a somewhat heart-shaped appearance. Matelea belizensis thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
